intro: Arctostaphylos viscida subsp. viscida, commonly known as the sticky madrone, is a shrub or small tree native to the western United States. It is characterized by its smooth, reddish-brown bark and elliptical, glossy evergreen leaves. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped white or pink flowers in late spring, followed by red or orange berries. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. Its subspecies is distinguished by its sticky resinous coating on the leaves and stems.
